column1: were speaking the truth in Court. The infirmities that had been brought to
the notice of the trial Court are certainly attributable to  human weaknesses

in  observation  and  faulty  memory. 
Is 
it 
reasonable 
to  expect  from  a
conductor  to  keep  a  tab  on every passenger who boards a  bus  with  exact

details  of  them?  The  answer  is  clearly  in  the  negative. 
This  Court  also

holds  the  view  that none  of  these  inconsistencies 
are  sufficient  to  assail
the testimonial  trustworthiness of these witnesses.
